nodes.name: Crab Shaft Top Door (to Pseudo Plasma Spark)
nodes.devNote: No spawnAt and no junction below, because the door can be entered with just a crouch jump

strats.name: Crab Shaft Suitless Walljump Climb with HiJump
strats.note: Wall jump back and forth up the shaft. It's a really long climb.

strats.name: Frozen HiJump
strats.note: Differs from crab climb in that the crabs only serve as one-time stepping stone between platforms.

strats.name: Frozen SpringBall
strats.note: Differs from crab climb in that the crabs only serve as one-time stepping stone between platforms.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with HiJump
strats.note: Only requires a runway of approximately 1 tile in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
strats.note: Requires at least 13 tiles in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster, Spring Ball
note: Requires running a very precise distance of approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room, to hit a peak in the speed / height relationship.
The spring ball jump is used after landing near the top, to get to the platform below the door.

strats.name: Crab Shaft Bottom Frozen Falling Crab
strats.note: Involves a Super to freeze a crab in midair.

strats.name: Crab Shaft Bottom Frozen Crab Steps
note: Freeze a crab below the opening, and another one at the ceiling on the lip of the entrance.
Stand on a frozen crab and crouch jump to the one on the ceiling.
When against the top crab, press into it to be pushed up onto it.

strats.name: Crab Shaft Bottom Repetitive Walljumps
note: Similar to naked watering hole escape.
Freeze a crab under the gap above, do a stationary spinjump facing right, then walljump until you're up.
Another frozen crab can help complete the way up.

enemies.note: They move around the external walls even when offscreen, and can be brought to any of their home nodes.

strats.name: Aqueduct Top Door Snailstep
strats.note: Involves waiting around for a snail to come along, in order to reach the door by jumping while standing on it.

strats.name: Aqueduct Top Door Crouch Jump
strats.note: Crouch on the ledge to the left where Samus is mostly hanging off, jump then move over quickly without spin jumping.

enemies.note: It's stuck in a prison and you need morph to enter.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Botwoon Hallway Puyo Ice Clip
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Herding the rightmost puyo into the ice clip position. It will become uncooperative after a few tries

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Botwoon Hallway Suitless Crystal Flash Clip
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
This is for the much harder version, without Gravity and Morph Bombs.

strats.name: Botwoon Hallway Puyo Ice Clip (Left to Right)
Botwoon CF Clip (Left to Right)
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
They are on the far right of the ceiling of the bottom right pathway.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
The vertical positioning can be setup using Gravity and Morph Bombs.

strats.name: Botwoon Hallway Suitless CF Clip (Left to Right)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Botwoon Hallway Suitless Crystal Flash Clip
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
They are on the far right of the ceiling of the bottom right pathway.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
This is for the much harder version, without Gravity and Morph Bombs.

strats.name: Botwoon Hallway Puyo Ice Clip (Right to Left)
Botwoon CF Clip (Right to Left)
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
They are on the far left of the ceiling of the middle left pathway.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
The vertical positioning can be setup using Gravity and Morph Bombs.

strats.name: Botwoon Hallway Suitless CF Clip (Right to Left)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Botwoon Hallway Suitless Crystal Flash Clip
note: Find the crumble blocks and crystal flash mid-air, just below them.
They are on the far left of the ceiling of the middle left pathway.
Hold down as the CF ends to break the non-respawning crumble blocks.
This is for the much harder version, without Gravity and Morph Bombs.

nodes.name: Botwoon 1
Back-Side Botwoon

locks.name: Back-Side Botwoon Fight: Charge, Wave, Gravity

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Fight: Gravity, Charge, Wave
unlockStrats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Back-Side Botwoon Fight with Charge and Wave
note: With Gravity, dodging the acid is pretty trivial.
Even without knowing about the distance trick expected in the suitless version.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Fight: Suitless, Charge, Wave
unlockStrats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Back-Side Botwoon Fight with Charge and Wave
note: Even when suitless, it's possible to stand far enough that the acid attack doesn't spawn.
Botwoon still gets hit. So there's a safe way to take no damage.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Microwave
unlockStrats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Back-Side Botwoon Magic Pixel Beam Fight
note: Stand on the appropriate pixel for shooting diagonally through the wall and use the microwave trick to defeat Botwoon.
Using angle up, it is where Samus' front foot is on the seam in the floor.
There is not proper spacing for landing an angle down shot and xraying.
Waiting for Botwoon to peak their head through the wall works too but is less safe.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Magic Pixel
unlockStrats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Back-Side Botwoon Magic Pixel Beam Fight
note: A charge beam shot will pass right through the dividing wall if fired from the correct 2pixel window.
Using angle down the spot is where Samus' front toe touches the wall.
Using angle up, it is where Samus' front foot is on the seam in the floor.

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Plasma Shield Fight
unlockStrats.note: Stand near the dividing wall and unleash the Plasma Special Beam Attack!

unlockStrats.name: Back-Side Botwoon Super Only Fight
unlockStrats.note: Wait for the one pattern (bottom->right) where Botwoon's head passes through the dividing barrier briefly and fire a Super Missile.  This takes a long time.

nodes.note: This represents fighting Botwoon from behind the wall.

nodes.name: Botwoon 2

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Back-Side Botwoon Fight with Charge and Wave
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Use Charge and Wave to kill Botwoon from the right, through the wall.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Back-Side Botwoon Magic Pixel Beam Fight
note: Stand on a particular two pixels to the right of the dividing wall and fight Botwoon using charge beam shots.
Using angle down the spot is where Samus' front toe touches the wall.
Using angle up, it is where Samus' front foot is on the seam in the floor.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
strats.note: Needs max horizontal speed coming from 44 runway tiles in the adjacent room.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster, Spring Ball
strats.note: Needs a runway of approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room, to get enough height. This is a peak of height with speed booster, no hjb, while underwater.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The canComeInCharged with 180 frames remaining is intended to logically include an in-room short charge.

strats.name: Suitless Spark
strats.note: Coming in with zero momentum, all it takes is one non-hjb full height bounce forward, then activate.

to.note: Direct link passing below. Passage above should go 4 -> 5 -> 1.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
strats.note: Requires approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room, as this is a peak in jump speed.

strats.name: Midair Morph
note: With Gravity, this means taking it off to mid-air morph. That doesn't count as true suitless Maridia.
There are otherways to do this than a mid-air morph, but they have more requirements than this strat which isn't even notable.

strats.name: Midair Morph
note: With Gravity, this means taking it off to mid-air morph. That doesn't count as true suitless Maridia.
There are otherways to do this than a mid-air morph, but they have more requirements than this strat which isn't even notable.

bypassStrats.name: Halfie Climb Room Xray Climb Grapple Clip
note: Perform an Xray Climb until you are just above the door into Cacatac Alley.
Walk left into the gap between pipes, behind the grapple blocks.
Walk to the left wall, turn around, crouch, grapple the block and release.
Samus will fall into the door transition.
The camera Does not follow Samus but the pipes are still visually in the same position.  And the camera does not break after the transition.

strats.name: Halfie Climb Enter with Shinespark from the Bottom Right
note: Quickly shoot out the 3 shot blocks then horizontal spark breaking the speed blocks.
Wait for the Oums to roll on their own to a place where they can be climbed.
Do not stand on the Oums when they begin to attack.

nodes.name: Draygon

unlockStrats.name: Draygon Grapple Kill
note: Kill Draygon by grappling to the top left turret.
Number of Draygon hits seems to vary, taking a worst case guess at 5.

unlockStrats.name: Draygon Grapple Quick Kill
note: Kill Draygon by grappling to a bottom turret as you get grabbed.
Avoids taking all the hits from Draygon.

unlockStrats.name: Draygon Shinespark Kill
unlockStrats.note: Shinecharge in-room, then horizontally spark through Draygon multiple times.
unlockStrats.devNote: 150 frames is an approximate sum of all required shinesparks.

unlockStrats.name: Suitless Draygon
unlockStrats.note: Fight Draygon without gravity, but with morph.
unlockStrats.devNote: This will require coming into the fight with ammo to kill the turrets. Although that ammo could instead be farmed in the fight.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Air Ball

strats.name: Draygon HiJumpless Speedjump
note: There is a very precise speed where the hjless speedjump is doable.
Starting against the left wall, jump just to the left of the rightmost pipe sticking out of the ground.

strats.name: Suitless shinespark
strats.note: Takes more time to setup than suited. but you can spark from a bit farther out because of the water physics.

nodes.name: East Cactus Alley Junction (Bottom Left)
East Cactus Alley Junction (Top Right)

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Doesn't require anything, but getting out does.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Assist
strats.note: Requires a runway of at least 1.5 tiles in the adjacent room, although it is easier with more.

strats.name: East Cac Alley Cross Room Jump with IBJ
note: Requires a runway of at least 1.5 tiles in the adjacent room, although it is easier with more.
Start the IBJ as far left as possible. The furthest right is just right of the waterfall.
At the top of the IBJ bomb to the left and unmorph to reset fall speed.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with HiJump
strats.note: Requires a runway of at least 2 tiles in the adjacent room.

strats.name: East Cac Alley Cross Room Jump with Spring Ball, Bomb Boost
strats.note: Use the bomb boost as Samus is going through the doorway, then spring ball after breaking the water, then ibj or use an unmorph bomb boost.
devNote: This strat requires a minimum of 2 bomb/PBs.
FIXME This is technically not canSpringBallJumpMidAir, but instead a bomb boost then springball jump, this tech should be added eventually.

strats.name: Cross Room Jump with Speedbooster
note: Requires a runway of approximately 7.5 tiles in the adjacent room, to hit a peak of the speed vs height graph.
Spring ball can be used with the speed to get all the way to 3, but it's tricky

strats.name: HiJump Walljump
strats.note: HiJump also makes it possible to escape the water suitless.

strats.name: East Cactus Springwall
strats.devNote: Requires only Gravity because suitless requires HiJump anyway.

strats.name: Base
note: This requires taking off Gravity to do a mid-air morph.
There is a way to get across without taking any damage from spikes or Cacatacs, although it's a bit tricky.

strats.name: Cacatac Alley Springball Spike Boost
strats.note: When the Cacatac on the ground fires a spike, perform a  springball Jump to break the waterline and then hit the spike for extra height.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: There is a way to avoid taking damage through the room, even without mid-air unmorphing.

strats.name: Suitless
strats.note: There is a way to avoid taking damage through the room, even without mid-air unmorphing.

strats.name: Suitless
note: It's possible to get out of the sand suitless and without hjb after falling from the chute, by hugging the left side and moving quickly.
However, getting across the sand chute right-to-left or left-to-right without sinking isn't possible in those conditions.

rooms.name: Toilet Bowl

nodes.name: Toilet Bowl Top Door (to Plasma Spark)
Toilet Bowl Bottom Door (to Oasis)

rooms.note: This is the vertical pipe that connects Plasma Spark Room and Oasis. Visually it looks like a portion of Aqueduct and Botwoon Hallway (and surroundings).
devNote: There are no links because Samus can't move freely between the nodes.
Traversal through the room happens via each node's spawnAt property, placing Samus at the other end of the room with no option but to leave.
